unnormalised: EdTech startup 'ShikshaSphere' raises ₹25 Cr in Series A funding, led by Sequoia Capital India. The platform, which boasts 1.2 million registered users across India, offers online courses primarily focused on STEM subjects for students in classes 6th to 12th. ShikshaSphere reported a 300% growth in user base over the past year, largely attributed to its interactive learning modules and personalized mentoring programs.
normalised: EdTech startup 'ShikshaSphere' raises rupee twenty five crore in Series A funding, led by Sequoia Capital India. The platform, which boasts one point two million registered users across India, offers online courses primarily focused on S-T-E-M subjects for students in classes sixth to twelfth. ShikshaSphere reported a three hundred percent growth in user base over the past year, largely attributed to its interactive learning modules and personalized mentoring programs.

unnormalised: The company plans to utilize the fresh capital to expand its course offerings to include vocational training programs such as coding and digital marketing. CEO, Mr. Rakesh Sharma, stated their aim to reach 5 million students within the next 2 years. They also intend to invest heavily in R&D, focusing on AI-powered personalized learning experiences, specifically targeting students in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities.

unnormalised: Furthermore, ShikshaSphere has announced partnerships with several state governments to provide subsidized online learning to economically disadvantaged students. The company is also exploring collaborations with IIT Delhi and IIM Ahmedabad for curriculum development.
